result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin J Kops

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief - includes 15CF759 & 15CF990

Clerk Charli
Case Called: 11:52 a.m.
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Def appears in person with Atty Harold C Wolfgram.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.


State moves to:
In 15CF759: CT 1. (Bail Jumping- Felony)>> DRI
                    : CT 2. (Bail Jumping- Felony)>> DRI
                    : CT 3. (Battery/DA)>> DELETE DA
                    : CT 4. (Disorderly Conduct/DA) >> DELETE DA
In 15CF990: CT 1. (Bail Jumping- Felony)>> DRI
COURT grants above.

PLEA: 
In 15CF759: CT 3. (Battery)>> NC
                    : CT 4. (Disorderly Conduct)>> NC

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: S/H 2 years probation. CONDITIONS: SAFE Intake as required and any follow up counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by dept.; AODA; Assessment/Counseling/Treatment as deemed appropriate by dept.; Absolute Sobriety; DNA Sample and Surcharge; Maintain Fulltime work/schooling/ or combination of both, if not 10 hours of CS per week and good faith effort to find employment; No Contact with A.M. unless agent approves; CC.

Restitution Hearing to be Set.
Adj: 12:00 a.m.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s):  A.M. (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
